answers.answer: Not sure if I understand your question. Are you wanting to get off of the vicodin? If so, can you please let us know how many you are taking a day and what mg. Giving us this info can help us prepare you for what is to come. Have you considered tapering? It takes so much willpower but can help the withdrawals be less severe. There is also a pain management forum along with a forum for people that have fibro. At the top of the page click on forums. It will bring up a list of all of the forums that med help has to offer. You may be able to get some ideas on what other people are doing to control their pain.Brian

There never is going to be a right time .Many of us have chronic pain and are no longer taking narcotics it is not easy but its doable and in the end you will probably find the pain is less without the narcotic then there was when you were on them.There are a few fibro meds out there now that are non narcotic .How are you getting your meds now ?

question: I am a single mom with two kids and no support.  I started on Vicodin 3 yrs. ago for fibromylga and it really helped.  I tried other things, natural as well, and this was the only thing that really worked with almost no side effects.  I don't want to be on any kind of meds but cannot take the pain, cannot afford treatment, and don't even have anyone to take my kids for a while.  Please help.  I am also very depressed and have not had good luck with antidepressants in the past.  I recently moved and have been under UNBELIEVABLE stress this past year, custody battle, home schooling my son with asperger's and brittle diabetes, and more. I don't even know where to start--
title: when is the right time?
